head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 3 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Palladius and Jerome. Lives and Anecdotes of Ascetics, taken chiefly from the works ofPalladiusandHieronymus. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 5 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Lives and Anecdotes of Ascetics, taken chiefly from the works of Palladius and Hieronymus
Life of Pachomius
msItem.incipit: ܣܦܩܐܝܬ ܐܝܟ ܕܣ̇ܒܪ ܐܢܐ̇. ܡܨ̈ܝܢ ܠܡܥܕܪܘ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܟܬܒ. ܗ̇ܝ ܗܟܝܠ ܕܠܘܬܗܝܢ ܟܕ ܠܘܬܗܝܢ ܢܪܗܛ. ܙܗܝܪܐ ܛܒ ܡܥܒܕܐ ܠܗ ܠܫܡܘܥܐ܇ ܠܘܬ ܬܐܘܪܝܐ ܕܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܡܬܐܡܪ̈ܢ. ܗ̇ܝ ܕܝܢ ܕܡܛܠ ܡܐܝܢܘܬܐ ܢܫܬܐܠ ܕܢܟܬܘܒ ܗܠܝܢ܆ ܩܝܢܕܘܢܘܣ ܡܝܬܐ ܥܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܫܬ̇ܐܠ. ܒܕܓܘܢ܆ ܟܕ ܡܢ ܕܪܫ ܪܗܛܝܢ ܚܢܢ ܒܡܠܬܐ܆ ܐܚܝ̈ܢܝܬܐ ܩܠܝܠ ܕܗܠܝܢ ܩܕܡ̈ܝܬܐ ܐܡܪܝܢ ܚܢܢ܀ ܥܝܕܐ ܐܝܬ ܗܘܐ ܠܐ̈ܚܐ܆ ܕܪܚ̇ܡ ܐܠܗܐ ܘܩܕܝܫܐ ܐܒܘܢ ܦܟܘܡ܆ ܒܟܘܠ ܪܡܫܐ ܒܕܘܟܬܐ ܡܬܚܡܬܐ܇ ܒܕܝܪܐ ܠܡܬܟܢܫܘ܆ ܡܛܠ ܕܢܫܡܥܘܢ ܡܠܦܢܘܬܗ. ܏ܘܫ..

msItem.title: Life of Malchus, the captive monk, by Hieronymus
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܡܛܠ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܫܒܝܐ ܕܫܡܗ ܡܠܟܐ.
msItem.note: Instead of Nisibeni agelli colonus, at the beginning of cap. ii., the Syriac has:ܐܢܐ ܐܬ̇ܝܠܕܬ ܒܩܪܝܬܐ ܕܡܬܩܪܐ ܚܣܝܒܢܐ.

msItem.title: A passage found in some copies of the Paradise, after the account of John of Lycos
msItem.rubric: ܠܗܢܐ ܕܘܒܪܐ ܪܬܚ̇ܐ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܐܚܪܢܐ ܐܫ̇ܟܚܬܐ ܡܢ ܒܬܪ ܕܘܒܪܐ ܕܛܘܒܢܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܚܒܝܫܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܠܘܩܘܣ.

msItem.title: Life of Jacob the wandering monk
msItem.note: After a short introduction, we read as follows,fol. 37 b:ܗܘ̣ܐ ܐܢܫ ܡܫܢܝܢܐ ܒܩܘܪܝܬ ܡܕܝܢܐ ܕܡܬܩܪܝܐ ܗܘܬ ܦܪܦܘܪܐܘܢ (Porphyreon in Phoenicia) . ܕܫܡܗ ܗܘܐ ܝܥܩܘܒ. ܗܢܐ ܟܕ ܦܪܫ ܢܦܫܗ ܡܢ ܣܕܝܩܘܬܗ ܕܥܠܡܐ ܗܢܐ. ܥܡ̣ܪ ܒܡܥܪܬܐ ܚܕܐ ܚܡܫܥܣܪܐ ܫ̈ܢܝܢ. ܗܢܐ ܟܠܗ ܒܡܝܬܪܘܬܐ ܘܒܥܢܘܝܘܬܐ ܐܬܪܒܝ. ܐܝܟܢܐ ܕܡܝܩܪܐ ܘܡܝܬܪܐ ܢܬܚܘܐ ܠܐܠܗܐ. ܘܢܫܬܘܐ ܠܡܘܗܒܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܫܐ̈ܕܐ. ܘܕܐܣ̈ܘܬܐ ܐܚܪ̈ܢܝܬܐ ܣܓ̈ܝܐܬܐ. ܒܫܡܗ ܕܦܪܘܩܢ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܢܫܡܠܐ. ܟܠܢܫ ܗܟܝܠ ܟܕ ܡܬܕܡܪ ܗܘܐ ܒܕܘܒܪܗ ܕܓܒܪܐ ܠܘܬܗ ܪܗܛܝܢ ܗܘܘ. ܕܣܘܓܐܗܘܢ ܡܢ ܕܚܠܬܐ ܕܫܡܪ̈ܝܐ ܪ̈ܫܝܥܐ ܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ ܗܘܘ. ܏ܘܫ.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8in. by 6, consisting of 48 leaves. The quires, 5 in number, are now signed with letters. Each page has from 28 to 31 lines. The writing is a fine, regular Estrangela of the viithor viiithcent., except on fol. 3 (originally one of the fly-leaves), which is of the xiith cent

collation.p: The quires, 5 in number, are now signed with letters.

layout.p: Each page has from 28 to 31 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is a fine, regular Estrangela of the viith or viiith cent.

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.p: Fol. 3 (originally one of the fly-leaves) is of the xiith cent.

item.label: Ownership Inscription
item.p: On fol. 2a there is a note (perhaps applying to the whole volume, Add. 12,175 ), which states that the manuscript belonged to the convent of S. Mary Deipara, having been purchased for it by Matthew, Abraham, Theodore, and Joseph, of Tagrit:

p.quote: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩ̈ܛܐ. ܕܩܢܘܗܝ ܡܢ ܡܕܡ ܕܙܢܬ ܐܢܘܢ ܛܝܒܘܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ. ܡܬܝ ܘܐܒܪܗܡ ܘܬܐܝܕܪܐ ܘܝܘܣܦ ܬܓܪ̈ܝܬܢܝܐ. ܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܒܗ ܢܨܠܐ ܥܠܝܗܘܢ ܡܛܠ ܡܪܢ. ܘܟܠܡܢ ܕܠܚܐ ܠܥܘܗܕܢܐ ܗܢܐ. ܢܬܠ̣ܚܐ ܫܡܗ ܡܢ ܣܦܪܐ ܕܚ̈ܝܐ. ܏ܘܫ..

item.p: These lines are written over a more ancient note, of which only the concluding words are left,

p.quote: ܒܦܣܩܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ. ܘܐܢ ܡܡܪܚ ܒܗ ܒܦܣܩܐ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ.

item.p: A few words lower down inform us that the book was repaired and bound by one Ephraim

p.quote: ܨܒܬ ܘܕܒܩ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܐܟܣܢܝܐ ܡܪܝܐ ܢܚܣܐ ܠܗ ܐܡܝܢ܀.

item.p: On fol. 1a there is a later note, repeating the statement that the manuscript belonged to the convent of S. Mary Deipara; and under it are the letters G. PP.

accMat.p: Fol. 3 (originally one of the fly-leaves) is of the xiith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: . In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 14 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Extracts from the Lives of the Egyptian Fathers
Selections from the works of Evagrius
Short extract
msItem.incipit: ܐܢ ܒܨܘܡܐ ܫ̇ܪܝܬ݂ ܦܓܕ ܠܫܢܟ

msItem.title: Extract
msItem.incipit: ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒ̇ܥܐ ܝܕܥܬܐ܆ ܢܬܪܘܨ ܝܬܗ ܕܠܐ ܚ̈ܫܐ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: Extract
msItem.incipit: ܝܪ̈ܘܬܘܗܝ ܕܐܠܗܐ܆ ܫܡܥܘ ܡ̈ܠܘܗܝ ܕܐܠܗܐ

msItem.title: Of the Seraphim
msItem.incipit: ܣܪ̈ܦܐ ܕܫܬܐ ܓܦܝ̈ܗܘܢ̣ ܩܢܘ̈ܡܐ ܡ̈ܠܝܠܐ ܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ

msItem.title: Of the Cherubim
msItem.incipit: ܟܪ̈ܘܒܐ ܣ̈ܓܝܐܝ ܥܝ̈ܢܐ ܩܢܘ̈ܡܐ ܡ̈ܠܝܠܐ ܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ

msItem.title: Extract
msItem.incipit: ܕܒܚܬܐ ܕܟܝܬܐ ܐܝܬܝܗ̇܆ ܬܐܪܬܐ ܕܟܝܬܐ ܘܠܐ ܒܨܘܝܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: Extract
msItem.incipit: ܥܩܪܐ ܕܡܫܝ̈ܓܢܐ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ܆ ܬܘܬ ܢܦܫܐ ܚܡܝܡܬܐ̇ ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: Extract
msItem.incipit: ܐܝܩܛܪܘܣ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ܆ ܬܐܪܬܐ ܢܣܝܣܬܐ ܕܢܦܫܐ̇ ܒܕܟܪܝܗܐܝܬ ܚܝܪܐ ܒܐܠܗܐ ܘܒܬܐܘܪܝܐ ܕܥܒ̈ܝܕܐ.

msItem.title: Sayings of the disciples of Evagrius
msItem.incipit: ܥܠܡܐ ܗܢܐ ܠܐܝ̈ܠܝܢ ܕܡܫ̣ܠܡܝܢ ܡܠܬܐ̣ ܚܡܫܐ ܗܘ ܒܫܒܐ. ܠܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܝܢ ܕܡܛܝܒܝܢ ܢܦܫܗܘܢ ܠܘܬ ܐܝܕܥܬܐ ܕܗ̇ܘ ܕܥܬܝܕ݂ ܥܪܘܒܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: Letters of Evagrius to Melania
Letter of Ignatius to Polycarp of Smyrna
msItem.note: Cf. Cureton's Corpus Ignatianum, p. xxix. and p. 2.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 5/8, consisting of 32 leaves (Add. 12,175, foll. 49—80), some of which are slightly stained by water. The quires, three in number, are now signed with letters. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 47 to 56 lines. This manuscript is written in a small, neat character of the vith cent., perhaps by the same scribe as foll. 81—254 (see no. DCCXXVII.), in which case its date is A.D. 534.

collation.p: The quires, three in number, are now signed with letters

item.p: Some of the leaves are slightly stained by water

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 47 to 56 lines.

handDesc.handNote: This manuscript is written in a small, neat character of the vith cent., perhaps by the same scribe as foll.81-254(See no. DCCXXVII .), in which case its date is A.D. 534.

item.p: On fol. 80b a reader called Bar-sauma has recorded his name:

p.quote: ܐܢܐ ܒܪܨܘܡܐ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܐܟܣܢܝܐ ܕܩܪܝܬ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ. ܏ܘܫ

head.note: This manuscript contains: . In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 69 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Works of Evagrius
The Six Centuries
msItem.finalRubric: ܫ̣ܠܡ ܡܐܘ̈ܬܐ ܫܬ ܕܪ̈ܫܐ ܕܝܕܥܬܐ ܕܐܡܝܪ̈ܝܢ ܠܛܘܒܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ.

msItem.title: Concerning the things that happen in dreams
msItem.incipit: ܐܡܬܝ ܕܒܫܪ̈ܓܪܓܝܬܐ ܕܫܢܬܐ ܒܡܢܬܐ ܕܪܓܬܐ ܡܩܪܒܝܢ ܥܡܢ ܕܝ̈ܘܐ̣. ܏ܘܫ
msItem.note: Compare Gallandii Bibl. Vett. Patrum, t. vii., p. 563.

msItem.title: Asceticon, dedicated to Anatolius
msItem.rubric: ܟܬܒܐ ܐܣܩܝܛܝܩܘܢ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ ܛܘܒܢܐ
msItem.note:
The introduction,fol. 101 a, is identical with that prefixed to the Capita practica in Gallandii Bibl. Vett. Patrum, t. vii., p. 553 ; but the treatise is that which, in Add. 14,578, (no. 4, fol. 34 b) , is entitled
ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܐܘܓܪܝܣ ܕܥܠ ܬܡܢܝܐ ܚ̈ܘܫܒܝܢ, discourse on the eight evil thoughts .

Here the title is,fol. 101b, 2nd col.,
ܦܘܢܝ ܦܬܓܡܐ ܡܢ ܟ̈ܬܒܝ ܩܘܕܫܐ. ܠܘܩܒܠ ܕܝ̈ܘܐ ܕܡܢܣܝܢ ܠܢ, answers from the Holy Scriptures to the demons that tempt us
.

msItem.title: Life of Evagrius, ascribed to Basil
msItem.rubric: ܢܨܚܢܐ ܕܥܒܝܕ ܠܛܘܒܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܒܣܝܠܝܣ ܥܠ ܛܘܒܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ ܕܐܝܟܢܐ ܫܪܝ ܘܐܝܟܢܐ ܫܠܡ ܪܗܛܗ ܕܒܥܠܡܐ
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܒܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܪ̈ܫܐ ܕܝܕܥܬܐ. ܘܥܠ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܚ̈ܠܡܐ ܓܕܫܢ. ܘܬܘܒ ܟܬܒܐ ܐܣܩܝܛܝܩܘܢ. ܘܩܘܠܣܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ.
msItem.note: It is, however, almost identical with the account of Evagrius by Palladius, as given in Rosweyde's Vitae Patrum, p. 763 , or in Migne, Patrologiae Cursus Completus, Series Lat., t. lxxiii., col. 1182; Migne, Patrologiae Cursus Completus, Series Gr., t. xxxiv., col. 1188

msItem.title: Tract entitled,on thoughts of every kind, in 26 sections
msItem.note: It corresponds with the treatise de diversis malignis cogitationibus in Nili Opera, ed. Suaresius, p. 512. See Add. 14,578, no. 6 .

msItem.title: Part of Works of Evagrius
Part of Works of Evagrius
Part of Works of Evagrius
Part of Works of Evagrius
Part of Works of Evagrius
Part of Works of Evagrius
Part of Works of Evagrius
Part of Works of Evagrius
Part of Works of Evagrius
Part of Works of Evagrius
msItem.note: It corresponds with the Rerum monachalium rationes in Gallandii Bibl. Vett. Patrum, t.vii.,p. 566 . See Add. 14,578, no. 10.

msItem.title: Part of Works of Evagrius
Part of Works of Evagrius
msItem.note: It is the Tractatus ad Eulogium in Nili Opera, ed. Suaresius, p. 408 . See Add. 14,578, no. 3.

msItem.title: Treatise against the eight evil thoughts, viz.,ܚܡܬܐ ܣܪܝܩܐ, ܥܩܬܐ, ܩܘܛܥ ܪܥܝܢܐ, ܫܘܒܚܐ, ܪܒܘܬ ܟܪܣܐ, ܙܢܝܘܬܐ, ܪܚܡܬ ܟܣܦܐ, and ܪܡܘܬܐ
Discourses of Marcus the monk
On the Spiritual Law
msItem.note: See Gallandii Bibl. Vett. Patrum, t. viii., pp. 3-13

msItem.title: On those who think that they can be justified by works
msItem.note: Cf. Gallandii Bibl., t. viii., pp. 13-27.

msItem.title: Copious extracts from the works of and Hieronymus on the Lives of the Egyptian Fathers
Part of Copious extracts from the works of Palladiusand and Hieronymus on the Lives of the Egyptian Fathers
Part of Copious extracts from the works of Palladiusand and Hieronymus on the Lives of the Egyptian Fathers
Of the fear of God
msItem.incipit: ܒܥܠܕܒܒܐ ܗܘܝ̣ ܠܟܠܗܝܢ ܣܟ݂̈ܠܘܬܐ. ܫܦܠܘܬܐ̣ ܪܕܦܐ ܠܕܚܠܬܗ ܕܐܠܗܐ. ܫܒܝܘܬܐ ܕܝܼܢ ܪܕܦܐ ܛܒ̈ܬܐ ܡܢ ܢܦܫܐ.

msItem.title: The first epistle of Antony
msItem.note: See Gallandii Bibl. Vett. Patrum, t. iv., p. 659.

msItem.title: Further excerpts from the Lives of the Egyptian Fathers
Of the Vision of God
Further extracts from the Lives of the Egyptian Fathers, such as Isidore, Didymus, Macarius, Nathaniel, Paul, Aurelius, Stephen, Moses and Pior
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܬܫܥ̈ܝܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܕܘܒܪ̈ܐ ܕܐܒ̈ܗܬܐ ܡܨܪ̈ܝܐ

msItem.title: Further extracts from the same work
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܬܫܥ̈ܝܬܐ ܕܐܒ̈ܗܬܐ ܡܨܪ̈ܝܐ ܠܐܚ̈ܐ ܕܐܬ̇ܝܢ ܕܢܬܬܠܡܕܘܢ ܘܢܗܘܘܢ ܝܚ̈ܝܕܝܐ.

msItem.title: On actions and thoughts
msItem.incipit: ܩܕܡܝܐ ܕܟܠܗܘܢ ܥܒ̈ܕܐ ܛܒ̈ܐ̣ ܡܟܝܟܘܬܐ. ܩܕܡܝܐ ܕܝܢ ܡܢ ܟܠܗܝܢ ܒܝ̈ܫܬܐ̣ ܪܡܘܬܐ

msItem.title: On good works
Sayings of Antony and Paphnutius
Doctrine of the Fathers

incipit.sic: ܡܢ ܩܕܡܝ ܟܠ ܡܕܡ ܣܢܝܩܝܢ ܚܢܢ ܥܠ ܡܟܝܟܘܬܐ ܒܟܠ ܡܕܡ̣. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: To those who dwell with one another
msItem.incipit: ܐܢ ܥܠ̣ܬ ܕܬܥܡܪ ܥܡ ܐܚ̈ܐ̣. ܛܪ ܢܦܫܟ ܕܠܐ ܬܣܒ ܦܪܗܣܝܐ̣. ܘܡܫ̇ܠܡ ܐܢܬ ܥܘܡܪܟ݂ ܒܫܠܡܐ..
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܬܫ̈ܥܝܬܐ ܕܕܘܒܪ̈ܐ ܕܐܚ̈ܐ ܝܚܝ̈ܕܝܐ ܕܗܘܘ ܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܡܨܪܝܢ..

msItem.title: Sayings of Abbā Poemen
Sayings of Abbā Moses
msItem.rubric: ܗܠܝܢ ܫܒ̈ܥ ܡ̈ܠܝܢ ܕܟܬ݂ܒ ܐܒܐ ܡܘܫܐ ܠܐܒܐ ܦܘܝܡܢ. ܕܟܠ ܕܢܛ̇ܪ ܠܗܝܢ ܡܫܟܚ ܡܬܦܪܩ ܡܢ ܓܗܢܐ. ܘܡܬܬܢܝ̣ܚ ܟܠ ܐܝܟܐ ܕܨܒ̇ܐ ܕܢܥܡܪ. ܐܢ ܒܕܝܪܐ ܘܐܢ ܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܘܐܢ ܒܝܬ ܒ̈ܢܝܢܫܐ.

msItem.title: Anecdotes of the Fathers in the Thebaid
Writings of Macarius the Great, or the Egyptian
Hortatory address to those wishing to become ascetics
msItem.rubric: ܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܡܩܪܝܣ ܠܘܬ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܬܝܢ ܠܬܘܠܡܕܐ.
msItem.incipit: ܡܛܠ ܕܝܢ ܕܐܦ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܐ̈ܚܐ ܪ̈ܚܝ̇ܡܐ ܘܚܒ̈ܝܒܐ: ܙܒܢ̈ܬܐ ܣܓܝܐ̈ܬܐ ܒܝܕ ܪܬܚܐ ܕܚܘܒܟܘܢ ܕܠܘܬ ܐܠܗܐ܆ ܫܐܠܬܘܢ ܡܢ ܒܨܝܪܘܬܝ ܡܠܬܐ ܕܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ: ܘܫ.

msItem.title: On the inward passions of the soul
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ ܚ̈ܫܐ ܓܘ̈ܝܐ ܕܢܦܫܐ ܟܘܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܫܪܪܐ ܡܢ ܟܘܠܗ ܠܒܗ ܨܒ̇ܐ ܠܡܫܦܪ ܠܐܠܗܐ܆ ܠܐ ܙܕܩ̇ ܠܗ ܕܒܐܝܩܪܐ ܢܦܫܗ ܢܐܚܘܕ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.incipit: ܠܘܬ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܡܬܩܪܒܝܢ ܠܐܘܪܚܐ ܕܫܪܪܐ

msItem.title: Address to those who draw nigh to the path of truth
msItem.incipit: ܟܘܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܗܟܝܠ ܕܨܒ̇ܐ ܠܡܬܩܪܒܘ ܠܐܘܪܚܐ ܕܫܪܪܐ: ܕܗ̣ܝ ܡܫܟܚܐ ܡܩܪܒܐ ܠܘܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܠܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܪܕܝܢ ܒܗ̇ ܬܩܢܐܝܬ ܐܝܟ ܨܒܝܢܗ ܕܐܠܗܐ܆ ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: On repentance
msItem.incipit: ܢܬܘܒ ܐܚ̈ܝ ܚܒܝ̈ܒܐ. ܗܐ ܓܝܪ ܒܕܡܘܬ ܥܪܦܠܐ ܚܡܬܐ ܦܪܝܣܐ ܥܠ ܗܘܢܢ.

msItem.title: Letters of Macarius, eight in number
Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܐܒܐ ܡܩܪܝܣ ܟܬܒ ܠܟܘܠܗܘܢ ܒܢ̈ܘܗܝ ܚܒܝ̈ܒܐ. ܟܕ ܡܦܝܣ ܠܗܘܢ ܘܫܐ̇ܠ ܒܫܠܡܗܘܢ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܠܒ̈ܢܝܐ ܪ̈ܚܝܡܐ ܡܘ̇ܕܐ ܐܢܐ ܬܘܒ ܠܐܠܗܐ܆ ܕܐܫܟܚܬ ܦܫܝܩܘܬܐ. ܕܒܝܕ ܟܬܝܒ̈ܬܐ ܐܥܗܕܟܘܢ܆ ܏ܘܫ..

msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܠܐ ܐܢܫ ܡܫܟܚ ܕܠܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܡܪ̈ܘܢ ܢܦܠܚ. ܠܐ ܡܫܟܚܝܢ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܕܠܘܩܒܠ ܐܠܗܐ ܬܗܘܘܢ ܘܠܘܩܒܠ ܥܠܡܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܒܥܘ ܡܢ ܡܪܝܐ ܕܗܟܢܐ ܬܬܪܨܘܢ ܥܝ̈ܕܝܟܘܢ. ܢܘܟܪܝܐ ܗܝ ܓܝܪ ܠܝܚ̈ܝܕܝܐ ܕܗܘܘ ܪܓܙܝܢ. ܏ܘܫ..

msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܠܝܬ ܕܪܡܐ ܡܢ ܕܚܠܬ ܐܠܗܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܡܛܠ ܕܫܐܠܬܘܢ ܕܬܐܠܦܘܢ ܡܛܠ ܡܟܝܟܘܬܐ: ܘܐܢܐ ܠܐ ܐܗܡܝܬ ܠܡܬܠ ܡܕܡ ܕܝܠܦܬ ܡܢ ܐܒܗ̈ܬܐ܆ ܒܦܣܝ̈ܩܬܐ ܐܡ̇ܪ ܐܢܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܪܒܐ ܗܝ ܛܝܒܘܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܒܚܫܝܫܘܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܚܛ̈ܗܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of Letters of Macarius, eight in number
msItem.incipit: ܗܫܐ ܬܠܬ ܐܢܝܢ ܕܡܟܬܪ̈ܢ. ܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ̇ ܘܣܒܪܐ̣ ܘܚܘܒܐ. ܪܒܐ ܗܝ ܓܝܪ ܫܪܝܪܐܝܬ ܘܣܓܝ ܝܩܝܪܐ ܨܒܘܬܗ ܕܚܘܒܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: The Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number
msItem.note: This manuscript reckons only thirteen epistles, the rubrics of the fifth and thirteenth being omitted.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number

msItem.incipit: ܟܬܒܬ ܠܟܘܢ ܗܕܐ ܐܓܪܬܐ܆ ܐܝܟ ܠܪ̈ܚܡܝ ܐܠܗܐ. ܘܒܥ̈ܝܘܗܝ ܒܟܘܠܗ ܠܒܐ. ܏ܘܫ..܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number
Part of the Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܝܕܥ̇ ܐܢܐ ܕܟ݁ܬܒ ܐܢܐ ܠܟܘܢ ܐܝܟ ܕܠܒܢ̈ܝܐ ܚܒ̈ܝܒܐ. ܘܠܒܢ̈ܝ ܡܘܠܟܢܐ ܘܠܒ̈ܢܝ ܡܠܟܘܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number

msItem.incipit: ܠܚܒ̈ܝܒܐ ܕܒܡܪܢ. ܠܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܬܐܚܫܒܘ ܒܡܢܬܐ ܕܡܠܟܘܬܐ ܕܫܡܝܐ. ܗܟܢܐ ܓܝܪ ܒܥܝܬܘܢܝܗܝ ܠܐܠܗܐ. ܟܕ ܡܬܕܡܝܢ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܠܐܒ̈ܗܝܟܘܢ ܒܗ̇ ܒܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.incipit: ܠܚܒ̈ܝܒܝ ܕܒܡܪܢ ܟܬ̇ܒ ܐܢܐ ܠܟܘܢ ܐܝܟ ܕܠܒ̈ܢܝܐ ܚܒܝ̈ܒܐ. ܐܦ ܐܒ̈ܗܬܐ ܓܝܪ ܦܓܪ̈ܢܝܐ ܝܬܝܪ ܡܚܒܝܢ ܠܒ̈ܢܝܗܘܢ܇ ܐܡܬܝ ܕܠܗܘܢ ܕܡ̇ܝܢ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.incipit: ܡܢ ܒܬܪ ܕܟܬܒܬܗ̇ ܠܐܓܪܬܐ܆ ܐܬܕܟܪܬ ܡܠܬܐ ܚܕܐ ܕܐܕܝܠܬܢܝ ܕܐܟܬܘܒ ܠܟܘܢ ܡܛܠ ܢܣܝܘܢܐ ܕܢܦܫܗ ܕܒܪܢܫܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number
Part of the Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܠܚܒ̈ܝܒܝ ܒܡܪܢ ܝܕܥܝܢ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܕܡܢ ܕܗܘ̣ܐ ܥܒܪ ܦܘܩܕܢܐ܆ ܠܐ ܡܫܟܚܐ ܢܦܫܐ ܕܬܕܥ ܠܐܠܗܐ܇ ܐܠܐ ܐܢ ܐܪܚܩܬ ܩܢܘܡܗ̇ ܡܢ ܒ̈ܢܝ ܐܢܫܐ ܘܡܢ ܟܘܠ ܥܢ̈ܝܢܝܢ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number
Part of the Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܗܐ ܚܘܝܬܟܘܢ ܚܒ̈ܝܒܝ ܕܫܠܝܐ. ܘܐܝܟܢܐ ܡܢ ܟܘܠܗܘܢ ܓܒ̈ܘܗܝ ܡܐܣܐ. ܘܐܝܟܢܐ ܐܠܗܐ ܨ̇ܒܐ ܒܗ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number
Part of the Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܫܐܠ ܐܢܐ ܒܫܠܡܟܘܢ ܒܪܘܚܐ ܡܟܝܟܬܐ. ܕܐܝܬܝܗ̇ ܕܫܠܡܐ. ܘܝܗܒܐ ܪܝܚܐ ܒܣܝܡܐ ܒܢ̈ܦܫܬܐ ܕܙܕܝ̈ܩܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of the Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number
Part of the Epistles of Ammonius, fifteen in number
msItem.incipit: ܗܐ ܗܢܐ ܟܪܛܝܣܐ ܕܟܬ̣ܒ ܠܟܘܢ ܐܒܘܟܘܢ. ܗܕܐ ܗܝ ܝܪܬܘܬܐ ܕܐܒ̈ܗܬܐ ܙܕܝܩ̈ܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: The book of the ܢܒܝܘܬܗ ܕܐܫܥܝܐ, prophet Isaiah, according to the Pěshīttā version.
msItem.note: The lessons are sometimes indicated by rubrics in the text, e.g. foll.245a, 246a.

msItem.title: Extracts from the writings of Basil
Letter to Gregory
msItem.rubric: ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܒܣܝܠܝܣ ܕܫܕܪ ܠܘܬ ܡܪܝ ܓܪܓܪܝܣ ܛܘܒܢܐ
msItem.incipit: ܐܫܬܘܕܥܬܗ̇ ܠܐܓܪܬܟ ܒܕܡܘܬܐ ܕܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܡܫܬܘܕܥܝܢ ܠܛ̈ܠܝܐ܇ ܡܢ ܕܘܡܝܐ ܕܩܢܝܢ ܠܘܬ ܐܒܗ̈ܝܗܘܢ̇.

msItem.title: Part of Extracts from the writings of Basil
Part of Extracts from the writings of Basil
msItem.incipit: ܥܡܠܐ ܓܝܪ ܕܛܒ̈ܬܐ ܕܢܣ̇ܒ ܥܝܕܐ ܡܢ ܙܒܢܐ ܙܥܘܪܐ̣. ܕܠܐ ܐܘܠܨܢܐ ܩܝܡܝܢ ܒܗ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܩܕܡܘ ܐܬܕܪܫܘ ܒܗ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Index

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 5/8, consisting of 174 leaves (Add. 12,175, foll. 81—254). The quires, 17 in number, are signed with letters, originally from ܝܕto ܠ, but now from ܝـto ܟܘ. A few of the leaves are much stained and slightly torn, and the ink is occasionally so faded that some passages have been retouched by a later hand, for example, foll. 81 b and 200 a. The first quire is imperfect at the beginning. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 32 to 68 lines. This manuscript is written in a small, neat hand of the vith cent., the precise date being, apparently, A. Gr. 845, A.D. 534 (see below).

collation.p: The quires, 17 in number, are signed with letters, originally from ܝܕ to ܠ, but now from ܝـ to ܟܘ

item.p: A few of the leaves are much stained and slightly torn, and the ink is occasionally so faded that some passages have been retouched by a later hand, for example, foll.81b and 200a.
The first quire is imperfect at the beginning.
The writing on fol.254b is much effaced, in part intentionally.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 32 to 68 lines.

handDesc.handNote: This manuscript is written in a small, neat hand of the vith cent., the precise date being, apparently,A. Gr. 845, A.D. 534. See additions.

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: Following the index is a note containing the date, which runs nearly as follows:

p.quote: [ܐܫـ]ـܬܠܡ ܕܝܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܒܫܢܬ [ܬܡܢـ]ـܡܐܐ ܘܐܪܒܥܝܢ ܘܚܡ̈ܫ. (؟) . . . ܐ̣ . . . ܪܝܢ. ܕܡܕܒܪܐ (؟) . . ܝ̈ܠܝܬܐ: ܒܩ̈ܕܝܫܘܗܝ (؟) ܕܪܚܡ [ܠ]ـܡܫܝܚܐ ܡܪܝ ܛܝܡܬܐܘܣ [ܐܦܝ]ܣـܩܘܦܐ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ [ܡـ]ܕܝܢܬܐ ܪܒܬܐ ܘܫܒ[ܝܚܬ]ܐ.

item.p: Hence it seems probable that the manuscript was written A. Gr. 845, A.D. 534, when Timothy III., who died in the following year, was patriarch of Alexandria(See Renaudot, Hist. Patr. Alexandrin. Jacob., p. 131 ; Le Quien, Oriens Christ., t. ii., col. 428 ; and compare Cureton, Corpus Ignat., p. xxix.). The remaining notes appear to contain the names of the scribe and of the person for whom, or at whose expense, the book was written; but neither can now be clearly deciphered. In the second column there is the following anathema:

p.quote: ܟܠ ܕܝܢ ܕܦ̇ܓܥ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ̇ ܘܫܡ̇ܥ ܠܡܠ̣ܟܗ ܕܣܛܢܐ ܘܓܢ̇ܒ ܠܗ̣. ܢܗܘܐ ܝܕ݁ܥ ܕܩܕܡ ܒܝܡ ܕܡܫܝܚܐ ܐܝܬ ܠܗ ܕܢܬܠ ܛܝܡ̈ܘܗܝ܀.

item.p: Underneath this are some lines of ancient Arabic writing, probably of the third cent. of the Hijra, much of which is no longer distinctly legible. The latter portion contains one of the usual anathemas:

p.quote: كل من يࢥرا في هدا الكتاب ويࢥطع وذه ورࢥه ... حط حرم لامسى
Whoever reads in this book, and cuts a leaf out of it….., may the curse of the Messiah…..

item.p: Observe the ancient punctuation of the kāf, ࢥ instead of قق.
On fol. 254a stands a more modern note, of the xth or xith cent., four lines of which have been purposely erased. Judging by what remains, the book belonged at this time to one Lazarus.

quote.sic: ܐܚ̈ܝ ܐܢܫ ܚܛܝܐ ܘܣܢܝܩ ܥܠ ܪܚ̈ܡܐ ܕܥ . . . ܕܒܝܬ ܐܣܛܘܢܐ . . . ܕܣܪܘܓ . . . ܕܝܪ̈ܝܐ ܗܢܘ ܕܥܬܝܕܝܢ . . . ܒܗܢܐ ܟܬܒܐ̣. ܕܢܒܥܘܢ ܪ̈ܚܡܐ ܡܢ ܡܪܢ ܕܢܚܣܐ ܠܗ ܡܪܢ ܚܘܒ̈ܘܗܝ ܘܚ̈ܛܗܘܗܝ ܣ̈ܓܐܝܐ ܡܛܠ ܡܪܢ . ܟܠ ܕܝܢ ܕܥܒܕ. ܐܦ ܠܗ ܐܠܗܐ ܢܚܣܐ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܝܠܗ. ܘܐܢܬ ܡܪܝ ܠܥܙܪ ܐܝܚܝܕܝܐ ܕܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܕܝܠܗ ܡܛܠ ܡܪܢ ܚܣܐ ܠܗ ܠܚܛܝܐ ܕܐܡܝܪ ܡܢ ܠܥܠ ܐܝܟܢܐ ܕܠܟ ܐܠܗܐ ܢܚܣܐ. ܟܠ ܕܡܨܠܐ ܢܨܠܐ ܠܦܝܠܓܐ ܨܠܘܬܝ ܥܠ ܕܣܪܛ.

item.p: Some passages have been retouched by a later hand, for example, foll. 81b and 200a.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Arabic Garshuni in East Syriac script

revisionDesc.change: CHANGED: added or corrected folio extent values

Incorporated all parts into one file 71.xml
